body:
[Reef-pull-request-ubuntu #485](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-ubuntu/485/) SUCCESS
This pull request looks good
This looks good to me but for one thing: The instantiation grabs explicit ports. It should instead use the `TcpPortProvider` mechanism.

I did a pass. My main concern is that I don't understand the need for many of the changes. Shouldn't this "only" change the clients to accept a couple of ints which they add to the `DriverConfiguration`?

Also, the change contains conflicts with current master, please resolve.
@markusweimer Thanks for the review. I've addressed the comments, except for the once I've replied to.

[Reef-pull-request-ubuntu #510](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-ubuntu/510/) SUCCESS
This pull request looks good

I'm concerned about the size of this change. Not in terms of lines changed, but lines added. This basically replicates the whole group communications code. While that is acceptable as a first step, it would be a troubling end state from a maintenance perspective, as we likely also replicate bugs :-)

Hence, let's try to reduce the amount of replicated code and functionality:
- I don't see why the topologies would have to exist twice. A tree is a tress, independent of what serialization scheme is used on its edges, right? What is the impossibility overcome by replicating it?
- The new API seems to be a generalization of the old one. Hence, we should be able to have only _one_ implementation. The _old_ APIs are then implemented on top of the _new_ ones.

[Reef-pull-request-ubuntu #511](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-ubuntu/511/) SUCCESS
This pull request looks good
This looks good. I will merge it.
@taegeonum I left some comments. There're a few confusing parts. Injection seems not to be fully done. Please address my comments and let me know when it's ready for another review.

Agree with Markus, the initial idea to use writableXXX, I guess was to avoid breaking the old code. But now it ends up too much duplication. It might be the time to discuss how shall we structure the code to use either "inheritance", or "uses", "has" relationships to make "writable" as one case.
Looking at it.

Yes..already filed a jira for that...After this initia checkin I can start
working on this whenever I get a new free time window
